sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: Kobakisa hydrogene-peroxide ya maimai ematisaka mosala ya nkisi ebomaka mikrobe. Nkisi ya koboma mikrobe oyo ezali na alcol 60 kino 95% ezali makasi na koboma mikrobe.
translated: Kobakisa hydrogène-peroxyde dilué ematisaka lisusu activité antimicrobienne.Ba sanitizers ya maboko oyo ezali na minimum ya 60 à 95% ya masanga ezali ba killers efficaces ya ba germes.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: Nkisi ya koboma mikrobe ezali na alcol ebomaka mikrobe, mikrobe oyo ekufaka te na nkisi ya mbuma (MRSA mpe VRE), tuberculose, mpe bavirisi mosusu (ata mpe SIDA, herpes, RSV, rhinovirisi, mangwele, grippe mpe hepatite) mpe champignon.
translated: Ba sanitizers ya kopangusa masanga ebomaka bactérie, bactérie oyo ekoki koboya bankisi mingi (MRSA mpe VRE), bokono ya ntolo, mpe ba virus mosusu (na kati na yango VIH, herpès, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, grippe, mpe hépatite) mpe ba champignons.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Nkisi ya kopetola maboko oyo ezali na alcol 70% ebomaka 99,97% (ekitisaka log na 3,5, mpe ekotisaka decibel na 35) ya mikrobe na maboko basegonde 30 nsima ya kosalela yango mpe 99,99% kino na 99,999% (ekitisaka log na 4 kino 5) ya mikrobe na maboko miniti 1 nsima ya kosalela yango. Nkisi ya kopetelo maboko ezali makasi mingi na koboma mikrobe kasi ezali makasi te na koboma bavirisi mosusu.
translated: Ba sanitizers ya kopangusa masanga oyo ezali na 70% ya masanga ebomaka 99,97% (3,5 log réduction, ekokani na 35 décibel réduction) ya bactérie na maboko 30 secondes après application mpe 99,99% na 99,999% (4 à 5 log réduction) ya bactérie na maboko 1 minute nsima ya kosalela yango.Ba sanitizers ya maboko ezali malamu mingi mpo na kobundisa bactérie mpe ezali malamu mingi te mpo na kobundisa ba virus mosusu.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Nkisi ya kopetola maboko oyo ezali na alcol ekokaka ata moke te bavirisi ebengami norovirisi (to Norwalk), oyo epanzaka mbala mingi mikrobe na misopo. Esengeli kosala antiseptique to alcol ya kosokola maboko na mingi oyo ekopɔlisa mpenza maboko nyonso mibale to ekotonda likolo na yango.
translated: Ba sanitizers ya maboko oyo esalemi na masanga ezali presque entièrement efficace te na ba virus ya type norovirus (to Norwalk), cause oyo emonanaka mingi ya gastro-entérite contagieuse.Esengeli kosalela antiseptique ya maboko to rub ya masanga ekoki mpo na ko mouiller malamu to kozipa maboko mibale.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: Liboso mpe nsima ya maboko nyonso mibale mpe katikati ya maboko mpe kosokola bansuka ya manzaka na basegonde 30 kino mai, fulufulu to gel ekokauka.
translated: Liboso mpe nsima ya maboko mibale mpe kati mpe nsuka ya misapi nyonso epangusami na boumeli ya pene na 30 secondes kino mayi, mousse to gel ekokauka.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: Esengaka kosokola mpe nsonge ya manzaka, kokutanisa yango na maboko nyonso mibale. Centre ya États-Unis mpona kolandela maladi mpe kobatela yango elobi ezali malamu mingi kosokola maboko na esika ya kosalela nkisi ya kopetola maboko, mingimingi soki maboko ezali mpenza mbindo.
translated: Esengeli mpe kosukola bansɔngɛ ya misapi malamu, kopangusa yango na mabɔkɔ nyonso mibale.Centre ya États-Unis mpo na kopekisa maladi epesi toli ya kosukola mabɔkɔ likoló ya biloko oyo basalelaka mpo na kosukola mabɔkɔ, mingimingi soki mabɔkɔ ezali bosoto oyo emonanaka.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: Bato bazali kosalela mingi nkisi ya mai ya kopetola maboko mpo ezali pete na kosalela mpe ebomaka mikrobe noki; kasi, tokoki kosalela yango te na esika ya kosokola maboko malamu na mai, kasi tokosalela yango kaka soki mai na savon ezali te.
translated: Bokóli ya kosalela biloko yango euti na pɛtɛɛ nyonso ya kosalela yango mpe mosala ya koboma nokinoki na mikrobe; nzokande, esengeli te kozala eloko oyo ekoki kozwa esika ya kosukola mabɔkɔ malamu longola kaka soki sabuni mpe mai ezali te.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: Kosalela mbala mingi nkisi ya kopetola maboko ezali na alcol ekoki kokausa mposo ya nzoto longola kaka soki babakisa na kati na yango biloko ekomisaka maboko sembesembe.
translated: Kosalela mbala na mbala ba sanitizers ya maboko oyo ezali na masanga ekoki kosala ete loposo ekauka longola se soki babakisi ba emollients mpe/to ba hydratants ya loposo na formule.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: Bakoki kolembisa to kolongola makasi ya alcol ya kokausa maboko soki babakisi glycerine mpe/to biloko mosusu oyo ekomisaka maboko sembesembe.
translated: Effet ya kokaukisa ya masanga ekoki kokitisa to kolongolama na kobakisa glycérine mpe/to biloko mosusu oyo elɛmbisaka nzoto na formule.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: Na ntango ya komeka mangwele na bato, bankisi ya kopetola maboko esalemi na alcol oyo ezali na biloko ekomisaka maboko pete, esalaki mokusa moke na mposo ya nzoto mpe ekausaki maboko mingi te neti basavon to bankisi oyo ebomaka mikrobe.
translated: Na ba études cliniques, ba sanitizers ya maboko oyo esalemi na masanga oyo ezali na ba emolliants esalaki que loposo esilisaka mpe ekauka mingi te koleka ba sabuni to ba détergents antimicrobiens.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: Mbala mingi mposo ya nzoto ekomaki te motane, ebimisaki te bambuma mpe eboyaki te bankisi esalemi na alcol to oyo batyaki bilangwiseli mosusu.
translated: Dermatite allergie ya contact, syndrome ya urticaire ya contact to hypersensibilité na masanga to ba additifs oyo ezali na ba froches ya maboko ya masanga esalemaka mingi te.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: Bato bakomaki kosepela mingi na kosalela bankisi oyo ekomisaka te mposo ya nzoto motane kasi te sabuni na mai mpo na kosokola maboko.
translated: Tendance ya nse ya ko induire dermatite ya contact irritant ekomaki attraction soki tokokanisi yango na kosukola maboko na sabuni mpe mayi.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: Ata ezali makasi, bankisi ya kopela maboko oyo ezali na mai elongolaka te na maboko na biloko ya organique, kasi epetolaka yango kaka.
translated: Atako ezali malamu, biloko oyo ezali na mai te epɛtolaka mabɔkɔ te na biloko oyo ezali na bomoi, kasi epɛtolaka yango kaka koboma mikrobe.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: Yango wana bankisi ya kopetola maboko ezali kosalisama mingi te soki tokokanisi yango na sabuni mpe mai mpo na kokanga mikrobe mingi nzela epanzana te, mpo mikrobe etikalaka na maboko.
translated: Ezali mpo na ntina yango nde bankisi ya kosukola mabɔkɔ ezali malamu te lokola sabuni mpe mai mpo na kopekisa kopalangana ya mikrobe mingi oyo epesaka maladi, mpamba te mikrobe yango etikali kaka na mabɔkɔ.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: Makasi ya bankisi ya kopetola maboko ezangi alcol eutaka mingi na biloko babakisaka na kati mpe na ndenge basalaka yango, mpe emonani ete eleki te nkisi ezali na alcol mpe oyo ezali na ntuku nsambo ya alcol.
translated: Efficacité ya sanitizer ya maboko sans masanga etali mingi ingrédients mpe formulation, mpe historiquement ezali significativement sous-performed masanga mpe masanga rubs.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: Kala mingi te, bankisi oyo batyaka chlorure ya benzalkonium ezalaki koboma mpenza mikrobe nsima ya kopakola yango, na bokeseni na alcol, oyo emonanaki ete makasi na yango esilaka soki basaleli yango mingi, mbala mosusu mpo ezalaka na ba matoma mingi na mposo ya nzoto.
translated: Kala mingi te, ba formulations oyo esalelaka chlorure de benzalkonium emonisami ete ezali na activité antimicrobienne persistante mpe cumulative sima ya application, na bokeseni na masanga, oyo emonisami ete ekitisaka efficacité sima ya kosalela yango mbala na mbala, mbala mosusu mpo na ba réactions adverses progressives ya loposo.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: Na bisika ya bobola, bato bakoki kosomba sabuni mpe kosalela putulu to mabele na esika na yango.
translated: Bato mingi na bisika oyo bato bazwaka mbongo mingi te, bakoki te kosomba sabuni mpe basalelaka mputulu to mabele na esika na yango.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: Putulu to mabele ekoki kozala makasi mingi koleka mai yango moko, kasi ezali makasi te neti sabuni.
translated: Mputulu to mabele ekoki kozala malamu koleka mai kaka, kasi ekoki kozala malamu mingi te koleka sabuni.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: Eloko moko ezali kotungisa ezali ete soki mabele to putulu ezali na mikrobe ekoki kosala maladi epanzana mingi na esika ya kokanga yango nzela epanzana mingi te.
translated: Moko ya mitungisi ezali ete soki mabele to mputulu ezali na mikrobe ekoki kobakisa kopalangana ya bokono na esika ya kokitisa yango.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Neti sabuni, putulu ezali mpe epetolaka mpo soki esangani na mai, esalaka solution ya alkaline.
translated: Lokola sabuni, mputulu ezali mpe eloko oyo ebomaka mikrobe mpo soki ekɔti na mai, esalaka solution alcalin.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: OMS ezali kolendisa kosalela putulu to zelo na esika ya sabuni soki sabuni ezali te.
translated: OMS epesaki toli ete mputulu to zelo ezala na esika ya sabuni soki sabuni ezali te.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: Mayele ebongi ya kosokola maboko elendisami na bacentre ya kobatela maladi ya États-Unis mpo kokanga maladi nzela epanzana te ezali oyo elandi:
translated: Technique correcte ya kosukola maboko oyo Centres ya Contrôle ya Maladi ya Etats-Unis epesi toli mpo na kopekisa bopanzani ya bokono ezali na ba étapes oyo elandi:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Kopolisa maboko na mai ya moto to ya malili oyo ezali kotambola.
translated: Kosopela maboko na mai ya molunge to ya malili oyo ezali koleka.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: Balobaki kosalela mai ezali kotambola mpo basani oyo efandi esika moko ekoki kozala na mikrobe, mpe temperature ya mai ezali na ntina moko te.
translated: Mai oyo ezali koleka ezali malamu mpo ete ba bassins oyo etelemi ekoki kozala na bosoto, nzokande molunge ya mai emonani lokola ezali kosala bokeseni te.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Kopolisa maboko na kopakolaka yango sabuni mingi, ata mpe na nsima ya maboko, na kati ya misapi, mpe na nse ya manzaka.
translated: Kopangusa mabɔkɔ na kopakolaka yango na sabuni mingi, ata mpe mokɔngɔ ya mabɔkɔ, na katikati ya misapi mpe na nse ya nsuki.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: Sabuni ebomaka mikrobe na mposo ya nzoto, mpe bolukiluki emonisi ete mbala mingi bato basokolaka maboko malamumalamu mpe ngonga molai soki soki sabuni esalemi aski kasi te soki basaleli mai yango moko.
translated: Savon etombolaka mikrobe na loposo, mpe bolukiluki emonisi ete bato bazalaka na momeseno ya kosukola mabɔkɔ malamu soki basaleli sabuni na esika ya kosukola yango kaka mai.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Pakola sabuni ata mpo na basegonde 20.
translated: Kopangusa na boumeli ya ata segɔnde 20.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Kosala bongo esalisaka na kolongola mikrobe na mposo ya nzoto, mpe kopokola ntango molai ebomaka mikrobe mingi.
translated: Kopangusa ebimisaka friction, oyo esalisaka mpo na kolongola mikrobe na loposo, mpe kopangusa na boumeli ya ntango molai elongolaka mikrobe mingi.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Pangusa maboko malamu na mai oyo ezali kobima.
translated: Sukola malamu na nse ya mai oyo ezali koleka.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: Kopangusa na sani ekoki kosala ete maboko ezwa lisusu bamikrobe.
translated: Kosukola na kati ya saani ekoki kozongisa maboko mabe.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Kokausa na elamba ya peto to tika ekauka na mopepe.
translated: Kauka na serviette ya peto to tika ekauka na mopepe.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Maboko oyo ezali na mai ezwaka mikrobe noki.Esika oyo mbala mingi esokolamana malamu te ezali mosapi ya monene, poignet, bisika ezali na katikati ya misapi, mpe na nse ya manzaka.
translated: Maboko oyo ezali na mai mpe oyo ezali na mai ekómaka lisusu na mikrobe na pɛtɛɛ nyonso.Bisika oyo bato mingi bazangaka ezali mosapi monene, loketo, bisika oyo ezali kati na misapi, mpe na nse ya nsuki ya misapi.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: Manzaka ya lekuta mpe biloko ya kopangusa manzaka ekoki kozala na mikrobe.
translated: Ongles artificiels mpe vernis ya nsuki oyo epanzani ekoki kobomba ba micro-organismes.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: Balendisaka mbala mingi kosalela mafuta ya kopakola mpona kosalisa maboko ekauka te; maboko ya kokauka ekoki kobebisa mposo ya nzoto mpe ekoki kosala moto azwa maladi kozanga mpasi.
translated: Mbala mingi, bapesaka toli ya kosala lotion oyo epɛtolaka mai mpo mabɔkɔ ekauka te; loposo ya kokauka ekoki komema na kobebisa loposo oyo ekoki komatisaka likama ya bopanzani ya bokono.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Mafuta mingi ya kopakola ya ntalo mingi te ekoki kosalelama mpo na kosalisa na kosokola maboko esika mai mpe/to sabuni ezali te na ndakisa kosopa mai longwa na eloko to kopo ezali na likolo mpe ezali na madusu ebongi mpe/to kosalela putulu soki esengeli na mikili ya bobola. Soki mai ezali mingi te (na ndakisa na biteyelo na bamboka na mikili ya bobola), bazali te na makoki ya kobatela mai, na ndakisa “tippy-taps” mpe lolenge mosusu oyo esengaka mbongo mingi te.
translated: Ba options ndenge na ndenge ya talo moke ekoki kosalema pona ko faciliter kosukola maboko esika mayi ya robinet pe/to sabuni ezali te ndakisa kosopa mayi ya jerrycan to gourd oyo ekangami na mabulu oyo ebongi pe/to kosalela mputulu soki esengeli na ba pays en voie de développement.Na ba situations oyo ezali na ndelo bopesi mayi (lokola biteyelo to bamboka na bikolo oyo ezali na bokei liboso), ezali na ba solutions oyo ebatelaka mayi, lokola "tippy-taps" pe ba options misusu ya talo moke.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: Tippy-tap ezali mayele ya pete ya kosalela mebki oyo batye na likolo mpe bakangi na nsinga, mpe esimbani na nsinga mpona kosopa mwa mai na likolo ya maboko mpe sabuni.
translated: Tippy-tap ezali mayele ya pɛtɛɛ oyo esalelaka molangi oyo ekangami na nsinga, mpe levier oyo esalaka na makolo mpo na kosopa mwa mai likoló ya mabɔkɔ mpe sabuni.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: Kokausa maboko malamu ezali na ntina mingi mpo na kolongono ya nzoto, kasi ntembe ezali mingi na oyo etali lolenge ya malamu ya kokausa maboko na bawese ya bato mingi.
translated: Kokaukisa malamu maboko ezali eteni ya ntina mingi na mosala ya bopeto ya maboko, kasi ezali na mwa ntembe mpo na lolenge ya kokaukisa maboko oyo eleki malamu na bisika ya kosukola ya bato banso.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: Bolukiluki mingi ezali kosalisa ete elamba ya kosokola maboko ezali malamu mingi koleka machine ya kokausa maboko oyo ezalaka na bawese mingi.
translated: Bolukiluki oyo ezali se kobakisama emonisi ete basashe ya papye ezali pɛto mingi koleka bamasini ya kokaukisa mabɔkɔ na kura oyo ezwamaka na bisika mingi ya kosukola.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: Na 2008, bolukiluki moke esalemaki na Université Westminster, na Londres, mpe oyo mosolo na yango eutaka na kompani European Tissue Symposium, oyo esalaka elamba ya kokausa maboko, mpona kososola bokeseni ya bilamba ya kokausa maboko, machine ya kokausa maboko mpe machine ya sika ya kokausa maboko.
translated: Na 2008, boyekoli moko esalemaki na Iniversite ya Westminster, na Londres, mpe esungami na kompanyi oyo esalaka basashe ya papye Symposium ya misisa ya Mpoto, mpo na kokokanisa nivo ya bopɛto oyo epesami na basashe ya papye, na masini ya kokaukisa mabɔkɔ na mopɛpɛ ya molunge mpe na jet- ba sécheurs ya maboko ya mopepe.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: Nsima ya kosokola mpe kokausa maboko na machine ya kokausa maboko, motango ya mikrobe emataki na misapi na 194% mpe na maboko na 254%.
translated: Nsima ya kosukola mpe kokaukisa mabɔkɔ na masini ya kokaukisa yango na mopɛpɛ ya molunge, bamonaki ete motángo mobimba ya mikrobe ekómaki mingi na mwayene na 194 % na biloko oyo batyaka na misapi mpe na mabɔkɔ na 254 %.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: Nsima ya kosokola mpe kokausa maboko na machine ya kokausa maboko, motango ya mikrobe emataki na misapi na 42% mpe na maboko na 15%.
translated: Kokaukisa na sécheuse ya jet-air esalaki ete na mwayene motángo mobimba ya mikrobe oyo ezalaki na biloko oyo ekangamaka na misapi emata na 42 % mpe na mabɔkɔ na 15 %.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: Nsima ya kosokola mpe kokausa maboko na elamba ya kokausa maboko, motango ya mikrobe ekitaki, na misapi ekomaka 76% mpe na maboko ekomaki 77%. Bato ya siansi basalaki mpe baekzame mpona koyeba soki ete bato oyo bazalaki kosalela bawese mpe kati ya bawese epanzaki mikrobe nsima ya bandenge mingi ya kokausa maboko.
translated: Nsima ya kosukola mpe kokaukisa maboko na serviette ya papier, motango mobimba ya bactérie ekitisami na mwayene na ba tablons ya misapi kino na 76% mpe na maboko ya maboko kino na 77%.Bato ya siansi basalaki mpe ba tests mpo na koyeba soki ezalaki na potentiel ya contamination croisée ya ba usagers misusu ya salle de bains pe environnement ya salle de bains na tina ya lolenge moko moko ya méthode ya kokaukisa.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: Machine ya kokausa maboko, oyo ebimisaka mopepe na vitese ya 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), ekokaki kontinda bamikrobe ya mike na maboko na bisika kati na wese mpe kosimba bato misusu kati ya wese na molai ya 2 metele.
translated: Secheuse à air jet, oyo ebimisaka mopepe libanda ya unité na vitesse oyo balobi ya 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), ezalaki na makoki ya kopumbwa ba micro-organismes na maboko mpe na unité mpe ekoki ko contaminer ba usagers mosusu ya salle de bains mpe esika ya kosukola kino na ntaka ya mɛtrɛ 2.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: Kosalela machine ya kokausa maboko epanzaka bamikrobe ya mike mosika na 0,25 metele uta esika machine ezali.
translated: Kosalela sécheuse ya maboko na mopepe ya molunge epalanganisaka ba micro-organismes kino na 0,25 mètres ya sécheuse.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: Bilamba ya kokausa maboko elakisaki ata moko ya bamikrobe ya mike epanzanaki. Na 2005, na bolukiuki moko esalemaki na TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, batalelaki bandenge mingi ya kokausa maboko.
translated: Ba serviettes ya papier elakisaki bopanzani ya monene ya ba micro-organismes te.Na 2005, na boyekoli moko oyo esalemaki na TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, batalaki mayele ndenge na ndenge ya kokaukisa maboko.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: Bamonaki bokeseni oyo elandi na motango ya mikrobe nsima ya kokausa maboko:
translated: Mbongwana oyo elandi na motángo ya mikrobe nsima ya kokaukisa mabɔkɔ emonanaki:

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: Bakompani mingi oyo esalaka bamachine ya kokausa maboko ezali, mpe bakeseni bamachine ya kokausa maboko na bilamba ya kokausa maboko.
translated: Bato mingi oyo basalaka biloko ndenge na ndenge ya kokaukisa mabɔkɔ ezali, mpe bakokanisaki biloko oyo bakaukisi na mabɔkɔ na oyo ekaukisi na basashe ya papye.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: Kokausa maboko na kosalela bilamba ya kokausa maboko ezali lolenge mosusu ya kokausa maboko na ntango ya mobembo soki sabuni na mai eza te.
translated: Kosukola maboko na kosalelaka ba serviettes ya kosukola maboko ezali mwango mosusu na tango ya mobembo na bozangi ya sabuni mpe mayi.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: Bankisi ya kopetola maboko ya alcol esengeli kozala na 60% ya alcol.
translated: Sanitizer ya maboko oyo ezali na masanga esengeli kozala na masanga ata 60%.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: Bato bakomaki kosalela mingi bankisi ya kosokola maboko ntango mingi nsima ya ntango wana moto moko ya physique ya Hongrois Ignaz Semmelweis amonaki makasi na yango (na 1846) mpona kokanga maladi nzela epanzana te na bisika lopitalo.
translated: Kosukola mabɔkɔ na minganga ekómaki obligatoire kala nsima wana monganga ya Hongrie Ignaz Semmelweis amonaki ete ezali malamu (na 1846) mpo na kopekisa maladi na esika ya lopitalo.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: Ezali na bamachine mingi oyo ekundwelaka bato ya lepitalo na kosokola maboko soki babosani kosala yango.
translated: Ezali na baaparɛyi ya elektroniki oyo epesaka makanisi mpo na kokundwela basali ya lopitalo básukola mabɔkɔ ntango babosani.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: Bolukiluki moko emonaki ete motango ya kopanza maladi ekitaki soki bazali kosalela yango.
translated: Bolukiluki moko emonisi ete motángo ya bato oyo bazwaka mikrobe ekiti ntango basaleli yango.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: Bankisi ya kosokola maboko ezali mpona basegonde 15, kosalela mai mpe na sabuni mingi to mafuta ya kopakola na bisika nyonso ya loboko.
translated: Kosukola mabɔkɔ na monganga ezali na boumeli ya segɔnde 15 ata moke te, kosaleláká sabuni mingi mpe mai to gel mpo na kosala mopɛpɛ mpe kopakola eteni mokomoko ya mabɔkɔ.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Esengeli konika maboko elongo moko na kosangisaka yango na kati ya baninga.
translated: Esengeli kopangusa maboko esika moko na ba chiffres oyo ekangami.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: Soki ezali na mbindo na nse ya manzaka, tokoki kosalela mwa eloko mpo na kolongola yango.
translated: Soki biloko oyo ebebi ezali na nse ya nsuki ya misapi, bakoki kosalela brɔsi oyo ezali na nsuki mpo na kolongola yango.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Mpo mikrobe ekoki kotikala na mai na maboko, ezali ntina mingi kolongola mai wana mpe kopangusa yango na elamba ya peto.
translated: Lokola mikrobe ekoki kotikala na mai oyo ezali na mabɔkɔ, ezali na ntina mingi kosukola yango malamu mpe kopangusa yango na eloko ya kosukola oyo ezali pɛto.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: Na nsima ya kokausa, esengeli kosalela elamba ya kokausa mpona kokanga mai (mpe kofongola porte ya kobima soki ezali).
translated: Nsima ya kokaukisa, esengeli kosalela eloko ya kosukola ya papye mpo na kokanga mai (mpe kofungola porte nyonso ya kobima soki esengeli).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Yango esalisaka na kopekisa maboko ezwa mikrobe na bisika wana.
translated: Yango esalaka ete kozongela kobebisa mabɔkɔ te na bisika yango.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: Mokano ya kosokola maboko na kolongono ya nzoto ezali ya kolongola mbindo (“mikrobe”) mpe kopesa yango te na bato mosusu.
translated: Ntina ya kosukola maboko na esika ya bobateli bokolongono ezali ya kolongola ba micro-organismes pathogènes ("ba mikrobe") mpe koboya kopesa yango.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: Zulunalu ya Angleterre ya sika oyo elobelaka makambo ya kimonganga elobi ete na balepital bato mingi mpenza bazosokola maboko te, mpe minganga na mafulume mingi babosanaka mbala mingi kosokola maboko liboso ya kosimba bato ya maladi, nde bongo bapesaka bango mikrobe.
translated: Zulunalo New England Journal of Medicine eyebisi ete kozanga kosukola mabɔkɔ ezali kaka na nivo oyo endimami te na bisika mingi ya minganga, mpe ebele ya minganga mpe ba infirmiers babosanaka mbala na mbala kosukola mabɔkɔ liboso ya kosimba bato ya maladi, mpe na ndenge yango, bapesaka mikrobe ya mikrobe.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: Bolukiluki moko emonisaki ete kosokola maboko malamu mpe ndege mosusu ya pete ekoki kokitisa motango ya kopesa bato maladi ya makila na 66%. Organisation Mondiale ya Santé ebimisa mokanda moko ezali na mibeko etali kosokola maboko mpe kopangusa yango mpo na minganga.
translated: Bolukiluki moko emonisaki ete kosukola mabɔkɔ malamu mpe mayele mosusu ya pɛtɛɛ ekoki kokitisa motángo ya bato oyo bazwaka maladi ya makila oyo euti na cathéter na 66 %. Organisation mondiale de la santé ebimisi lokasa moko oyo ezali komonisa kosukola mabɔkɔ mpe kopangusa mabɔkɔ na ndenge ya momeseno na makambo ya kosalisa bato na maladi.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: Tokoki komona toli ya liboso ya kosokola maboko ya organization mpe ekoki mpe kozwama na siteweb na yango mpona maloba ya bato nyonso.
translated: Projet ya bokambi ya bopeto ya maboko na ebongiseli ekoki mpe kozwama na site internet na yango mpo na makanisi ya bato banso.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Whitby na baninga na ye basalaki botaleli ya ntina.
translated: Botali moko oyo etali yango esalemaki na Whitby et al.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: Bamachine oyo batekaka ekoki komeka mpe koloba soki maboko ezali peto, soki lolenge ya bopeto oyo basengi ekoki.
translated: Ba appareils commerciales ekoki ko mesurer pe ko valider hygiène ya maboko, soki esengeli kolakisa botosi ya mibeko.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: Organisation Mondiale ya Santé eza na “Bangonga Mitano” mpo na kosokola maboko:
translated: Organisation mondiale de la santé ezali na "Five Moments" pona kosukola maboko:

sourceString: after exposure to blood/body fluids
targetString: nsima ya kosimba makila/mai ya nzoto
translated: nsima ya kozala na makila/mai ya nzoto

sourceString: before an aseptic task, and
targetString: liboso ya kosala mosala oyo ya kobatela maboko na mikrobe, mpe
translated: liboso ya mosala moko ya aseptique, mpe

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: nsima ya kosalisa moto ya maladi. Kobakisa antiseptique na sbuni (sabuni “oyo ezali na nkisi” to sabuni “ebomaka mikrobe”) esalisaka nkisi ya kosokola maboko na koboma mikrobe.
translated: sima ya bobateli ya mobeli.Kobakisa ba produits chimiques antiseptiques na sabuni (ba savons "médicaux" to "antimicrobiens") epesaka action ya koboma na agent ya kosukola maboko.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Koboma mikrobe ekoki kozala ntina liboso ya kosala lipaso to na bisika oyo mikrobe ezalaka mingi mpenza. ‘Koningisa’ maboko mpo na lipaso, soki ezali ntina ezala na pompe oyo okoki kofungola mai to kokanga esengeli te basimba yango na maboko, mwa chlorhexidine to mai ya iodine, elamba ezangi mikrobe mpo na kokausa maboko nsima ya kosokola yango, mpe linyuka ezangi mikrobe mpona kolongola mbindo mpe eloko mosusu ezangi mikrobe mpona kolongola mbindo na manzaka.
translated: Mosala ya koboma motindo wana ekoki kolinga liboso ya kosala lipaso to na bisika oyo bikelamu oyo bizali koboya antibiotique bizali mingi.Mpo na ‘kopangusa’ maboko mpo na lipaso, esengeli kozala na robinet oyo ekoki kofungola mpe kokanga kozanga kosimba yango na maboko, mwa kosukola na chlorhexidine to iode, basashe oyo ezali na stérile mpo na kokaukisa maboko nsima ya kosukola, mpe brɔsi oyo ezali na stérile mpo na kopangusa mpe esaleli mosusu oyo ezali stérile mpo na kosukola na nse ya nsuki ya misapi.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Esengeli kolongola mayaka nyonso.
translated: Esengeli kolongola bijoux nionso.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: Lolende oyo esengeli kosokola maboko mpe liboso ya maboko kino katikati ya loboko, mingimingi na miniti 2-6.
translated: Procédure oyo esengaka kosukola maboko mpe liboso ya maboko kino na coude, mingi mingi 2–6 minutes.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: Koweumela na konika (miniti 10) ezali ntina te.
translated: Ba scrub-times milayi (10 minutes) ezali na ntina te.

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: Ntango ozali kopangusa, oesengeli kokanga nzela mpo mai oyo ezali na liboso ya maboko eleka te na nsima ya maboko.
translated: Ntango bazali kosukola, esengeli kopekisa mai oyo ezali na mabɔkɔ ya liboso ezonga na mabɔkɔ.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: Nsima ya kosilisa kosokola maboko, esengeli kokausa maboko na elamba ezangi mikrobe mpe kolata gan ya minganga.
translated: Nsima ya kosukola mabɔkɔ, bakaukisaka mabɔkɔ na elamba oyo ezali na mikrobe te mpe balataka elamba ya lipaso.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: Mpona kokanga mikrobe nzela ekabwana te, ezali malamu na kosokola maboko to kosalela antiseptique ya maboko liboso mpe nsima ya kosalisa moto ya maladi.
translated: Mpo na kokitisa kopalangana ya mikrobe, ezali malamu kosukola mabɔkɔ to kosalela antiseptique ya mabɔkɔ liboso mpe nsima ya kobatela moto oyo azali na maladi.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: Mpona kotalela maladi ya staphylocoque na balepital, emonani ete matomba ya monene ya kosokola maboko eyaki nsima ya kosokola maboko 20% ya liboso, mpe mwa litomba wana ezwamaki ntango bazalaki kosokola maboko na 35%.
translated: Mpo na kopekisa bokono ya staphylocoque na balopitalo, emonanaki ete litomba monene ya bopeto ya maboko ewutaki na 20% ya yambo ya kosukola, mpe ete litomba moke mpenza ya kobakisa ezwamaki ntango mbala ya bopeto ya maboko ebakisami koleka 35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: Kosokola na sabuni ekolisaka motango ya kopanza mikrobe ya maladi mbala misato na bilei soki tokokanisi yango na kosokola maboko na sabuni oyo ezali na nkisi ya koboma mikrobe. Bokeseni ya kopetola maboko na nkisi oyo ezali na alcol, kosokola maboko na sabuni ezali na nkisi ya koboma mikrobe na basegonde 30 ekitisaka motango ya kopanza mikrobe na 26% koleka soki basabuni ezali na nkisi ya koboma mikrobe.
translated: Kosukola na sabuni ya pamba epesaka koleka mbala misato taux ya bokono ya infectieux bactériens oyo epesamaka na bilei soki tokokanisi yango na kosukola na sabuni antibactérien.Kokokanisa kopangusa maboko na solution oyo ezali na masanga na kosukola maboko na sabuni ya antibactérien na tango ya moyenne ya 30 secondes moko na moko elakisaki ete kopangusa maboko na masanga ekitisaki contamination ya bactérie na 26% koleka sabuni ya antibactérien.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: Kasi sabuni na mai ezali makasi mingi koleka bankisi oyo ezali na alcol ya kopakola mpona kokotisa virisi A ya grippe H1N1 mpe clostridiume difficile spores na maboko. Milende ya kobongisa mosala kopetola maboko na balopitalo ekoki kosenga koteya bato ya mosala na kosokola maboko, kosala ete bato bazali na bankisi mingi ya kopetola maboko ezali na alcol, mpe makundoli ya kokoma mpe ya monoko na bato ya mosala.
translated: Kasi sabuni mpe mai ezali malamu koleka kopakola maboko na masanga mpo na kokitisa virus ya grippe A H1N1 mpe ba spores ya Clostridium difficile oyo euti na maboko.Ba interventions mpo na kobongisa bopeto ya maboko na bisika ya soins de santé ekoki kozala na mateya mpo na basali na oyo etali kosukola maboko, komatisaka bozali ya masanga kopangusa maboko, mpe makundoli ya kokoma mpe ya maloba na basali.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: Ezali na bolukiluki mingi mpo na koyeba nini ya mayele oyo ekosalisa na bisika mingi mpo na kolongono ya nzoto.
translated: Esengeli kosala bolukiluki mingi mpo na koyeba nini kati na ba interventions oyo ezali malamu mingi na bisika ndenge na ndenge ya soins de santé.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: Emonani ete na mikili ya bobola, kosokola maboko na sabuni ezali na ntalo malamu, ntina mingi mpo na kozala nzoto kolongono, mpe nkutu ntina mpo na kolya bilei ya malamu.
translated: Na mikili oyo ezali naino na bozwi mingi te, bato bandimaka ete kosukola mabɔkɔ na sabuni ezali esaleli oyo esɛngaka mbongo mingi te, oyo ezali na ntina mingi mpo na kolɔngɔnɔ ya nzoto, ata mpe kolya malamu.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: Kasi, kozanga mai, sabuni, bisika ya kosokola maboko na ndako, na biteyelo mpe na bisika ya mosala ezali kosala ete ezala mpasi mpo bato nyonso bakoma na ezaleli ya kosokola maboko.
translated: Kasi, bozangi ya mayi ya kotyela motema, sabuni to bisika ya kosukola maboko na bandako ya bato, na biteyelo mpe na bisika ya mosala esalaka ete ezala mokakatano mpo na kokokisa bizaleli ya kosukola maboko ya bato banso.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: Na ndakisa, na bamboka mingi ya Afrika bisika ya kosokola maboko pene ya bawese ya bato to ya piblik ezali mingi te, ata ete maponi ya ntalo moke ezali mpona kosala bisika ya kosokola maboko.
translated: Na ndakisa, na mikili mingi ya bamboka ya Afrika ba robinets ya kosukola mabɔkɔ oyo ezali pene na twalɛti nyonso ya bato to ya bato nyonso ezali mingi te, atako banzela ya ntalo moke ezali mpo na kotonga bisika ya kosukola mabɔkɔ.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: Kasi, kosokola maboko mbala mingi te ekoki kozala ezaleli moko oyo bato bamesana na yango kasi ezali te mpo bazangi sabuni na mai.
translated: Kasi, ba taux ya nse ya kosukola maboko plutôt ekoki mpe kozala résultat ya mimeseno oyo esimbami na esika ya kozala mpo na kozanga sabuni to mayi.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: Kotombola mpe kolendisa kosokola maboko na sabuni ekoki kopusa kopona mibeko, pusa maloba ya ntina ya kosokola maboko mpe kosalisa bato babongola mpenza bizaleli na bango.
translated: Botomboli mpe botomboli ya kosukola maboko na sabuni ekoki kozala na bopusi na mikano ya politiki, kotombola bososoli na ntina ya matomba ya kosukola maboko mpe komema na mbongwana ya bizaleli ya ntango molai ya bato.

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: Mpo esalama malamu, kolandela mpe botaleli ezali ntina mingi.
translated: Pona yango esala malamu, esengeli kolandela pe kotala.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: Kotalela bolukiluki 70 emonisaki ete kolendisa ezaleli ya kosokola maboko na bamboka ezali ntina mingi na LMICs, kasi kotelemela kopanza maloba ezali kosapema mingi te. Ndakisa moko ya kolendisa kosokola maboko na biteyelo "Mayele Misato" ya UNICEF oyo azali kolendisa biteyelo basala makambo ya pete, ya ntalo mingi te oyo ekokoki kosala bana ya kelasi basokola maboko na sabuni, kati ya bibongiseli mosusu mpona bopeto.
translated: Botali ya système ya ba études 70 emonisi que ba approches oyo esalemi na communauté ezali malamu pona komatisaka kosukola maboko na ba LMIC, alors que ba campagnes ya marketing social ezali malamu mingi te.Ndakisa moko pona promotion ya kosukola maboko na biteyelo ezali "Approche Three Star" ya UNICEF oyo elendisaka biteyelo e kosala makambo ya pɛtɛɛ mpe ya ntalo moke mpo na kosala ete bana-kelasi básukola mabɔkɔ na bango na sabuni, kati na masɛngami mosusu ya bopɛto.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: Soki biteyelo elongi kokotisa mwa bizaleli malamu, bakoki sikoyo koleka na oyo ya makasi.
translated: Ntango mibeko ya moke ekokisami, biteyelo ekoki kolongwa na monzoto moko kino na nsuka na minzoto misato.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: Kotonga bisika ya kosokola maboko ekoki kozala na kati ya makambo ya kotambola kopanza sango ya kosokola maboko oyo ezali kosalema mpo na kokitisa bokono mpe kufa ya bana.
translated: Kotonga bisika ya kosukola maboko ekoki kozala eteni ya bakampanye ya botomboli kosukola maboko oyo esalemaka mpo na kokitisa bokono mpe liwa ya bana.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: Mokolo ya kosokola maboko mpo na bato nyonso ezali ndakisa mosusu ya kapanza sango oyo ezali kosalisa bato na kobongola bizaleli. Ndenge maladi mabe ya coronavirisi 2019-20 ebimi, UNICEF azali kolendisa kobimisa emoji ya bosokoli maboko.
translated: Mokolo ya kosukola maboko na mokili mobimba ezali ndakisa mosusu ya campagne ya sensibilisation oyo ezali koluka kosala mbongwana ya bizaleli.Na ntina ya bokono ya coronavirus ya 2019-20, UNICEF elendisaki bondimi ya emoji ya kosukola maboko.

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: Bolukiluki mosusu etaleli motuya nyonso ya kosokola maboko na mikili ya bobola na oyo etali likebisi ya DALYs.
translated: Boyekoli moke nde etalelaki bokasi ya ntalo mobimba ya kosukola maboko na mikili oyo ezali naino na bokei liboso na boyokani na ba DALY oyo epekisami.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: Kasi, botaleli moko elakisi ete kolendisa kosokola maboko na sabuni esengaka mbongo mingi te soki tokokanisi yango na banzela mosusu na ndakisa mai mpe mayele mosusu ya kotya bopeto.
translated: Kasi, botali moko emonisi ete kolendisa kosukola maboko na sabuni ezali mpenza na ntalo moke koleka misala mosusu ya mai mpe bopeto.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: Ntina ya kosokola maboko mpo na kolongono ya nzoto ya mingimingi mpo na bato oyo baza na likama na ndakisa bamama oyo bauti kobota to basoda bazoki oyo bazali na balopitalo – bandimaki yango na mbala ya liboso na katikati ya siekle ya 19 na bato mibale oyo babandisaki mosala ya kosokola maboko: Ignaz Semmelweis, monganga ya Hongrois, oyo asalaki na Vienne, na Autriche mpe Florence Nightingale, moto ya Angleterre “oyo abandaki mosala ya mafulume".
translated: Ntina ya kosukola maboko mpo na bokolongono ya bato – mingi mingi mpo na bato oyo bazali na makambo ya mpasi lokola bamama oyo bautaki kobota to bazokisaki basoda na balopitalo – eyebanaki mpo na mbala ya yambo na katikati ya ekeke ya 19 na ba pionniers mibale ya bopeto ya maboko : monganga ya Hongrie Ignaz Semmelweis oyo asalaki na Vienne, Autriche mpe Florence Nightingale, Anglais "mobandisi ya infirmier ya mikolo oyo".

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: Na ntango wana, bato mingi bazalaki kondima kaka ete maladi euta na bansolo ya mabe oyo babengaki miasme.
translated: Na ntango wana bato mingi bazalaki naino kondima ete mikrobe eutaka na nsolo mabe oyo babengaka miasmas.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: Na mibu 1980, kobima ya maladi euti na bilei mpe ya maladi euti na kosalisa bato ya maladi, epusaki ba centre ya États-Unis oyo ebundisaka maladi mpe ebatelaka yango na kolendisa mingi lisusu bopeto ya maboko mpe koloba ete ezali ntina mingi mpo na kokanga maladi nzela epanzana te.
translated: Na bambula ya 1980, bokono oyo eutaka na bilei mpe bokono oyo euti na bokolongono ememaki ba Centres ya Etats-Unis mpo na kopekisa mpe kopekisa bokono mpo na kolendisa mingi bopeto ya maboko lokola lolenge ya ntina mpo na kopekisa kopalangana ya bokono.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: Kobima ya grippe ya bangulu na 2009 mpe ya maladi mabe ya COVID-19 na 2020, epusi bato ya mikili mingi batya likebi na ntina ya kosokola maboko na sabuni mpona komitabela na maladi mabe ya ndenge wana.
translated: Bopanzani ya grippe porcine na 2009 mpe pandemie ya COVID-19 na 2020 esalaki ete bato mingi bayebi mingi na bikolo mingi na ntina ya kosukola maboko na sabuni mpo na komibatela na bokono ya boye oyo ekoki kozwama.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: Na ndakisa, bapankarte bakoma "lolenge ya malamu ya kosokola maboko" batyaki yango pene ya bisika ya kosokola maboko ya bawese ya bato nyonso mpe na bawese ya babiro mpe ba aeroport na Allemagne.
translated: Ndakisa, ba affiches oyo ezalaki na "techniques correctes ya kosukola maboko" ekangamaki pembeni ya ba lavabos ya kosukola maboko na ba toilettes publics mpe na ba toilettes ya ba immeubles ya bureaux mpe ba aéroports na Allemagne.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: Maloba "kosokola maboko ya moto na" likambo moko, elingi koloba koboya kozwa mokumba mpona eloko moko to koboya kosangana na yango.
translated: Phrase "kosukola maboko na" eloko, elakisi kosakola kozanga bolingi ya moto ya kozua mokumba ya eloko to kokabola complicité na yango.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: Ebimelaki na eteni ya biblia esika Matayo akoma ete Ponte Pilato asokolaki maboko na ekateli ya kobaka Yesu Klisto na ekulusu, kasi ekoma maloba oyo bato basalelaka mingi na bamboka oyo bato balobaka Anglais.
translated: Ewuti na eteni ya bible na Matai esika wapi Ponse Pilate asukolaki maboko na ye ya mokano ya kobaka Yesu Klisto na ekulusu, kasi ekomi fraze oyo esalelami mingi na ba communautés mosusu ya Anglais.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: Na lisapo ya Shakespeare ebengami Macbeth, Mama Macbeth abandi kosokola maboko oyo esengami mpo na kopetola mbindo oyo ezalaki kaka na makanisi, oyo elakisi bososoli na ye ya mabe na makambo mabe ya kobuka mibeko oyo ye asalaki mpe apusaki mobali na ye na kosala.
translated: Na buku Macbeth ya Shakespeare, Lady Macbeth abandi kosukola mabɔkɔ na ye na makasi mpo na koluka kopɛtola litɔnɔ oyo akanisaki, oyo ezali komonisa lisosoli na ye oyo ezali na ngambo mpo na makambo ya mabe oyo asalaki mpe atindaki mobali na ye asala.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: Emonani ete nsima ya kokundwela bato bizaleli ya mabe to soki bango moko bakaniseli yango, mbala mingi bakosokola maboko koleka bato mosusu, mpe bazali na matondo mingi na biloko esalisaka na kosokola maboko.
translated: Emonani mpe ete bato, nsima ya komikundola to kokanisa misala oyo ezali na bizaleli malamu te, bazalaka na momeseno ya kosukola mabɔkɔ mbala mingi koleka bato mosusu, mpe bazalaka na momeseno ya kopesa motuya mingi na bisaleli ya kosukola mabɔkɔ.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: Lisusu, bato oyo bapesi bango nzela ya kosokola maboko nsima ya makanisi wana mingi basanganaka lisusu te na makambo misusu ya makasi ya “bopeto,” na ndakisa kosala mosala ya komipesa.
translated: Lisusu, baye bapesameli nzela ya kosukola maboko nsima ya komanyola ya boye bazali na likoki mingi te ya kosala misala misusu ya "kopetola" ya kofuta, lokola mosala ya bolingi.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: Na losambo, mangomba esengaka kosokola maboko mpo na bopeto mpe ya elilingi. Kosokola maboko ya elilingi, oyo basalelaka mai kasi sabuni te mpo na kosokola maboko, ezali bindimeli ya kosokola maboko na mangomba mingi, na ndakisa na lingomba ya Bahá'í, ya Hindou, ya tevilah mpe na netilat yadayim na lingomba ya Bayuda, Lavabo na lingomba ya Boklisto mpe Wudhu na lingomba ya ba Mizilma. Mangomba esengaka mpe bato basokola maboko mpo na bopeto, mingimingi nsima ya kosala makambo moko boye.
translated: Mangomba elakisaka kosukola maboko mpo na bopeto mpe mpo na ntina ya elilingi.Kosukola maboko na ndenge ya elilingi, kosalelaka mai kasi sabuni te mpo na kosukola maboko, ezali eteni ya kosukola maboko na milulu oyo emonisami na mangomba mingi, na ndakisa Kondima ya Bahá’í, Lingomba ya Hindu, tevilah mpe netilat yadayim na Lingomba ya Bayuda , Lavabo na boklisto, mpe Wudhu na Islam.Mangomba mpe esɛngaka kosukola mabɔkɔ na ndenge ya pɛto, mingimingi nsima ya kosala makambo mosusu.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: Lingomba ya Hindu, ya Bayuda mpe ya ba Mizilma batya mobeko ete bato basokola maboko nsima ya kokende na wese.
translated: Lingomba ya Hindu, Bayuda mpe Islam esɛngi kosukola mabɔkɔ nsima ya kosalela twalɛti.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: Lisusu, lingomba ya Hindu, ya Bouddha, ya Sikhi, ya Bayuda mpe ya Mizilma batya mobeko bato basokola maboko liboso mpe nsima ya kolya.
translated: Mpe, Lingomba ya Hindu, ya Bouddha, Lingomba ya Sikh, Lingomba ya Bayuda mpe Lingomba ya Islam esɛngaka kosukola mabɔkɔ liboso mpe nsima ya kolya nyonso.

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
targetString: Biloko ya komibatela na makama na mosala COVID-19
translated: Bopekisami ya makama na bisika ya mosala mpo na COVID-19

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Biloko ya komibatela na mosala mpo na COVID-19 eza kosalela mayele etali libateli mpe kolongono ya nzoto mpo na kokanga nzela ete maladi ya coronavirisi 2019 (COVID-19) epanzana te.
translated: Bopekisa makama na bisika ya mosala mpo na COVID-19 ezali bosaleli ya ba méthodologies ya bokengi mpe bokolongono na mosala mpo na bopekisa makama na bopekisi bokono ya coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
targetString: Lolenge ya malamu ya komibatela na mosala etaleli esika mosala esalemaka mpe mosala yango, etaleli makama ya komitika na makambo ya makama, ndenge maladi ekoti esika bofandi, mpe makama oyo bato ya mosala bakoki kozala na risque ya kozwa maladi ya COVID-19.
translated: Bokengeli malamu ya makama na esika ya mosala etali esika ya mosala mpe mosala ya mosala, na kotalaka botangi ya makama ya maziba ya bopanzani, makasi ya bokono na kati ya lisanga, mpe makambo ya makama ya basali moko moko oyo bakoki kozala na likama ya kozwa COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Na kotalela ministre ya libateli mpe santé ya États-Unis (OSHA), mosala eza na makama moke eza mosala oyo esengaka kokutana na bato mosusu mpe baninga ya mosala mingi te, oyo esengaka kosalela mayele ya ntina ya libateli, na ndakisa kosokola maboko, kolendisa bato ya mosala na kotikala na ndako soki bazobela, babelaka maladi ya mpema, mpe kozala na ezaleli ya kotya bopeto mpe ya kopetola esika ya mosala.
translated: Engebene ebongiseli moko (OSHA) ya États-Unis oyo etalelaka makambo ya bokengi mpe kolɔngɔnɔ ya nzoto na mosala (OSHA), misala oyo ezali na likama mingi te ya kokutana na bato ezali na boyokani mingi te na mosala na bato mpe baninga mosusu ya mosala, mpo na yango bapesameli toli ya kozwa bibongiseli ya ntina mpo na kopekisa maladi yango, bakisa mpe kosukola mabɔkɔ, kolendisa basali bátikala na ndako soki bazali na maladi , bizaleli malamu ya mpema, mpe kobatela bopɛto mpe koboma mikrobe mbala na mbala na esika ya mosala.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: Mosala ya likama ya katikati eza misala oyo esengaka kokutana mbala mingi to na pembeni na bato oyo oyebi to baoyo bakoki kozala na COVID-19, kasi bakoki kozala na maladi mpo bakutanaka na bato mingi to basalaka mibembo na mikili mingi.
translated: Misala ya risque ya exposition moyenne ezali na oyo esengaka kokutana mbala na mbala to ya penepene na bato oyo bayebani te to bakanisami ete bazali na COVID-19, kasi bakoki kozwa bokono mpo na bopanzani ya ba communautés oyo ezali kosalama to mibembo na mokili mobimba.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: Yango etali bato ya mosala oyo bakutanaka na bato mingi na ndakisa na biteyelo, na bisika ya mosala oyo bato bazalaka mingi, mpe na bisika mosusu oyo bato bazalaka mingi.
translated: Yango esangisi basali oyo bazali na boyokani na bato banso lokola na biteyelo, bisika ya mosala oyo bato bazali mingi, mpe bisika mosusu ya kotɛka biloko oyo ezali na bato mingi.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: Komibatela na makama na etuluku oyo, longola makambo bato nyonso basalaka mpo na komibatela na maladi, esengeli kosalela ventillateur oyo eza na bafiltre ya makasi mpenza, komibatela liboso ya kosala itche, mpe kozala na bisaleli ya komibatela soki okutani na moto oyo aza na maladi ya COVID-19.
translated: Ba contrôles ya ba danger pona groupe oyo, en plus ya ba mesures ya base ya prévention ya infection, ezali na ventilation na nzela ya ba filtres ya mopepe ya efficacité makasi, ba gardes ya étouffement, pe kozala na ba équipements ya protection personnelle disponible soki mutu oyo azali na COVID-19 akutani.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: OSHA etalelaka minganga mpe bato basalaka na morgue ete baza bato oyo bayebani to likoki ezali bakutana na moto aza na COVID-19 baza na likama ya monene, mpe esalaka ete bato oyo basalaka misala ya aerosol to basimbaka to bazwaka ba échantillon, ya bato oyo baza na COVID-19 to baoyo bakoki kozala na yango.
translated: OSHA etalaka basali ya bokolongono mpe ya bibembe oyo bakutanaki na moto oyo ayebani to oyo bakanisaka ete azali na COVID-19 bazali na likama monene ya kokutana na COVID-19, oyo emati na likama ya kokutana na yango mingi mpenza soki basali basali misala ya kobimisa aérosol na, to kosangisa to kosimba ba échantillons uta na, moto oyo ayebani to oyo bakanisaka ete azali na yango na COVID-19.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: Komibatela malamu na makama mpo na bato yo basalaka misala oyo ekoki kozala komibatela na bandako oyo eza na mopepe ya mabe ya ventillateur, mpe kozala na bilamba ya malamu ya libateli mpo na mosala wana.
translated: Ba contrôles ya ba danger oyo ebongi pona basali wana ezali ba contrôles ya ingénierie lokola ba salles ya ventilation ya pression négative, pe ba équipements ya protection personnelle oyo ebongi na mosala ya mosala.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: Kobima ya COVID-19 ekoki kozala na makama mingi na esika ya mosala.
translated: Bopanzani ya COVID-19 ekoki kozala na ba effets ebele na kati ya esika ya mosala.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: Bato ya mosala bakoki kozala te na mosala mpo bazobela, bazobatela bato mosusu, to bazobanga mbala mosusu bakokutana na moko aza na maladi wana.
translated: Basali bakoki kozanga mosala mpo na kobɛla, mposa ya kobatela basusu, to mpo na kobanga ete bakoki kokutana na yango.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: Lolenge ya kosala mombongo ekoki kobongwana, ekoki kozala na biloko bato bazoluka kosomba, mpe ndenge ya kozwa biloko yango (na ndakisa kosomba na ntango bato baza mingi to na nzela ya misala ya livraison à domicile).
translated: Mitindo ya mombongo ekoki kobongwana, ezala na oyo etali biloko nini esengami, mpe lolenge ya kozwa biloko yango (lokola kosomba na ngonga oyo bato bazali mingi te to na nzela ya misala ya bopesi to ya motuka).

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: Ya nsuka, bakoki kopekisa kokende kotika biloko na bisika oyo maladi ya COVID-19 eza mingi. Komibongisa na maladi ekoki kosalisa na koyeba nini tokosala mpo na komibatela.
translated: Na suka, ba envois ya biloko oyo ewutaka na ba zones géographiques oyo ezo tosa makasi na COVID-19 ekoki kokata.Mwango ya komilengela pe ya koyanola na bokono ya kozwama ekoki kosalelama pona kokamba misala ya bobateli.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: Baplan ezolobela nivo ya likama oyo eza na bisika ya mosala mpe misala, ata mpe bato oyo okokutana na bango, makambo ezosala makama ekoma mingi na ndako mpe bisika mosusu, mpe makama oyo bato ya mosala na ndakisa mibange to bato oyo baza na maladi esilaka te baza na yango.
translated: Miango etali nivo ya likama oyo etali bisika ndenge na ndenge ya mosala mpe misala ya mosala, bakisa mpe maziba ya bopanzani, makama oyo euti na bisika ya ndako mpe ya lisanga, mpe makama ya mosali moko moko lokola bobange to bokono ya monganga oyo eumelaka.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: Ezolobela mpe ndenge ya kolandela mpo na kobongisa makama wana, mpe lolenge ya kobongisa makambo oyo ekoki kobima mpo na maladi oyo.
translated: Bazali mpe kolakisa ba contrôles oyo esengeli mpo na kosilisa ba risque wana, mpe ba plans ya contingence mpo na ba situations oyo ekoki kobima na tina ya bopanzani ya bokono.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: Komibongisa na maladi mabe mpe makambo ya kosala mpo na kobundisa yango ekosalema na kolanda mibeko ya ekolo to ya mboka.
translated: Miango ya komibongisa mpe ya koyanola na bokono ya kozwama ekoki kozala na makanisi ya ekolo to ya ekolo moke.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: Lolenge malamu ya kobundisa yango etali makambo mpo na maladi oyo etali na ndakisa kokitisa ndenge ekoki kopanzana kati ya bato ya mosala, kobatela bato oyo baza na likama monene mpo baza na maladi ya kala, kokoba kosala mosala, mpe kosala makambo mpo ebebisa te mosala ya bakompani mosusu oyo basalaka elongo na bino.
translated: Mikano mpo na koyanola na bokono ezali kokitisa bopanzani na kati ya basali, kobatela bato oyo bazali na likama mingi mpo na mikakatano ya mabe ya bokolongono, kobatela misala ya mombongo, mpe kokitisa ba effets ya mabe na ba entités misusu na ba chaînes d’approvisionnement na bango.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: Makambo bokosala ekotalela ndenge oyo maladi yango ekoti na bongo na bino.
translated: Bokasi ya bokono na lisanga esika mombongo ezali etali biyano oyo ezwami.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: Koyeba ndenge moto na moto akosala makambo mpo na komibatela na makama eza mwango endimami mpo na kobatela bato ya mosala mpe kolongono ya nzoto ya bato mingi na kotalela bokasi na yango.
translated: Hiérarchie ya ba contrôles ya ba danger ezali cadre oyo esalelamaka mingi na sécurité na santé na mosala pona ko grouper ba contrôles ya ba danger na efficacité.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: Bisika bakoki kolongola te makama ya COVID-19, lolenge ya malamu koleka ya kobundisa yango eza kotalelaka ba mashine, nsima kotalela ya bakonzi, mpe na nsuka kopesa moto na moko bisaleli ebongi mpo na komibatela.
translated: Epayi wapi makama ya COVID-19 ekoki kolongolama te, ba contrôles ya malamu mingi ezali ba contrôles ya ingénierie, elandi na ba contrôles administratifs, mpe na suka ba équipements ya protection personnelle.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: Kotalela ba mashine elakisi kotya bato ya mosala mosika na makama ya mosala kozanga kobebisa bizaleli malamu ya mosala, mpe ekoki kozala lolenge ya malamu ya kosala makambo.
translated: Ba contrôles ya ingénierie esangisi ko isoler basali na ba dangers oyo etali mosala sans ko se fier na comportement ya mosali, pe ekoki kozala solution ya talo moke pona kosalela.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: Botaleli ya bakonzi ezali kobongola lolenge ya kosala mosala oyo ezosenga patron to moto ya mosala abongola ndenge na ye ya kosala.
translated: Ba contrôles administratifs ezali ba changements na politique to ba procédures ya mosala oyo esengaka action na mosali to patron.

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: Bisaleli ya komibatela (PPE) eza makasi mingi te soki tokokanisi yango na botaleli ya ba mashine to ya bakonzi, kasi ekoki kosalisa na kokima makama mosusu.
translated: Bisaleli ya bobateli moto (PPE) etalelami lokola ya malamu mingi te koleka ba contrôles ya ingénierie mpe ya administratif, kasi ekoki kosalisa mpo na kopekisa mwa ba expositions.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: Bosengeli kopona lolenge nyonso ya PPE na kotalela makama oyo eza mpo na moto ya mosala, soki ebongi mpenza (na ndakisa biloko esalisaka na kopema), kolata yango malamu mpe ntango nyonso, kobatela yango, mpe kotya ya sika, soki esengami, mpe kolongola yango malamu, kosokola yango, kobongisa to kobwaka yango mpo emema maladi te.
translated: Esengeli kopona mitindo nyonso ya PPE na kotalaka likama mpo na mosali, etiamaki malamu ndenge esengeli (ndakisa, ba respirateurs), kolata yango mbala na mbala mpe malamu, kotala yango mbala na mbala, kobatela yango, mpe kozongisa yango na esika na yango, soki esengeli, mpe kolongola yango malamu, kosukola yango, mpe kobombama to kobwakama mpo na koboya contamination.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: Na kotalela ministere ya libateli mpe kolongono ya nzoto (OSHA), makama ya moke na mosala eza oyo esengaka kokutana na bato mingi te mpe baninga ya mosala mingi te.
translated: Engebene Ebongiseli ya États-Unis oyo etalelaka makambo ya bokengi mpe kolɔngɔnɔ ya nzoto na mosala (OSHA), misala oyo ezali na likama mingi te ya kokutana na bato ezali na boyokani mingi te na mosala na bato mpe baninga mosusu ya mosala.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Lolenge ya malamu ya komibatela mpo maladi epanzana te na mosala oyo endimami eza kosokola maboko mbala na mbala, kolendisa bato ya mosala na kotikala na ndako soki bazobela, soki babelaka maladi ya mpema, kozipa monoko to zolo soki bakosoli to basali itche, kozala bilamba ya kopangusa mpe esika ya kobwaka yango, kobongisa bisaleli ya kosolola na mosika to mosusu soki eza ntina kopekisa bato ya mosala basalela bisaleli ya bato mosusu, mpe kobatela bizaleli ya kotya bopeto mpe kopetola esika ya mosala.
translated: Mibeko ya moboko ya kopekisa bokono oyo esengami mpo na bisika nyonso ya mosala ezali kosukola maboko mbala na mbala mpe malamu, kolendisa basali batikala na ndako soki bazali na bokono, etiquette ya mpema esangisi kozipa kosukosu mpe koswa, kopesa ba tissus mpe bisika ya bosoto, komibongisa mpo na mosala ya mosika to ya ba turs ya kokita soki esengeli, kolembisa basali longwa na kosalela bisaleli mpe bisaleli ya basusu, mpe kobatela bopeto mpe koboma mikrobe mbala na mbala na esika ya mosala.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: Koyeba noki bato oyo bakoki kozala na maladi mpe kotya bango mosika na basusu eza lolenge ya malamu mingi ya kobatela bato ya mosala, basombi, bapaya, mpe bato mosusu na esika ya mosala.
translated: Koyeba noki mpe kokabola bato oyo bakoki kozwa bokono ezali litambe ya ntina mingi mpo na kobatela basali, bakiliya, bapaya, mpe bato mosusu na esika ya mosala.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
targetString: Ba centre ya kobundisa maladi mabe mpe kobatela bato na yango (CDC) ya États-Unis ezolendisa ete bato ya mosala oyo baza na bilembo ya maladi ya makasi ya mpema batikala na ndako kino fievre, bilembo ya fievre, mpe bilembo mosusu ekosila ata na bangonga 24 kozanga kosala nkisi ya kokitisa fievre to nkisi mosusu mpo na bilembo mosusu, mpe batya mibeko malamu mpo na congé ya malamu, kopesa bato ya mosala nzela ya kotikala na ndako mpo na kobatela bato ya libota oyo bazobela, mpe ete bato ya mosala basengeli koyeba mibeko wana.
translated: Centres ya Etats-Unis mpo na kopekisa mpe kopekisa bokono (CDC) epesi toli ete basali oyo bazali na bilembo ya bokono ya mpema makasi basengeli kotikala na ndako kino bakozala na fièvre te, bilembo ya fièvre, mpe bilembo mosusu nyonso te na boumeli ya ngonga ata 24 kozanga kosalela bankisi oyo ekitisaka fièvre to oyo ebongoli bilembo mosusu, mpe ete mibeko ya konje ya maladi ekoki kobongwana, epesaka nzela na basali bátikala na ndako mpo na kobatela moto moko ya libota oyo azali na maladi, mpe ete basali bayebi mibeko yango.

sourceString: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
targetString: Na kotalela OSHA, likama ya katikati na mosala etali makambo neti bato oyo bakutanaka na bato mingi to bazalaka pene ya bametre 1,8 ya bato oyo baza na COVID-19 to oyo bazokanisa bakoki kozala na yango, kasi bakoki kozwa SARS-CoV-2 mpo maladi yango ezopanza mingi na esika bofandi na esika ya mosala, to mpo bato basalaki mobembo kala te na mikili mosusu esika COVID-19 ezopanzana mingi.
translated: Engebene na OSHA, misala ya likama ya exposition moyenne ezali na oyo esengaka kokutana mbala na mbala to penepene na kati ya makolo motoba (1,8 m) ya bato oyo bayebani te to bakanisaka ete bazali na bokono ya COVID-19, kasi bakoki kozala na bokono ya SARS-CoV-2 mpo na lisanga oyo ezali kokoba bopanzani nzinganzinga ya esika ya mombongo, to mpo ete moto yango auti kosala mibembo ya mokili mobimba na esika oyo bopanzani ya COVID-19 epalangani mingi.

sourceString: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
targetString: Etali bato ya mosala oyo bakutanaka na bato ya ndenge na ndenge na ndakisa na biteyelo, na esika ya mosala oyo bato bazalaka mingi mpenza, mpe na bisika mosusu ya bato mingi.
